name: 9 out of 10 testers
nomination_text: A shout out to the creators behind the 9 out of 10 testers YouTube channel. Great work you are doing.  Keep it up!

name: Al Goodall
nomination_text: Al is an amazing Lead Tester in our organisation and has recently instituted automated sanity checks in our production environments, cutting a manual task in half (at least!) and improving our responsiveness to deployment-related issues. Al, you have made our long-held dream a reality and I salute your resilience, determination and drive to get this done!

name: Karen Todd
nomination_text: Karen's YouTube videos exploring Software Testing Advocacy are innovative, interesting and useful.

name: Dimpy Adhikary
nomination_text: She is an expert in Testing both functional/Automation and overall. Her blog  is where she writes some practical advice. She is a detail oriented person. She has started an initiative which will help testers not only in testing or programming but also as on overall from various perspectives not just automation. The kind of questions you will see here would be very much different and shows her insights about testing. A great person to interact in communities. We need more people like who can act as Role Model for the community.

name: Vernon Richards
nomination_text: For learning new skills in public, sharing the results as well as the journey, both equally valuable.

name: Suman Bala
nomination_text: For helping me with the API chapter in our book when I was struggling. She's been very generous with her knowledge and I've learned so much from her.

name: Rita Avota
nomination_text: Rita has made my onboarding experience such a welcoming and positive one. She is infectiously calm and positive, and shares her expertise on a pair or group level for max impact. Keep being awesome Rita!

name: Louise Gibbs
nomination_text: The blogpost 'Testing is an underrated skill in Testing'. It's a good twist on the brief from the Ministry of Testing monthly blog post challenge on underrated skills in testing. Test automation isn't everything - testing is.

weblinks.name: Testing is an underrated skill in testing

name: Karo Stoltzenburg
nomination_text: Karo amazes me every time we work together with her structured approach and the excellent questions she asks and the ideas she comes up with.

name: Francis Bonsu
nomination_text: Very dedicated and determined tester who has over the years been passionate about testing.

name: Dave Clissold
nomination_text: Shoutout to Dave Clissold at THRIVE for working tirelessly to execute our E2E tests in our CI pipelines. His technical knowledge and mentoring is invaluable to the THRIVE Tech Team and wider Cypress community.

name: Ashley Graf
nomination_text: The blogpost 'Why code review is an underrated skill in testing'. I like it to be the first step I take before I start testing. I may not comment, but I definitely read it. I too often regret when I don't.

weblinks.name: Why code review is an underrated skill in testing

name: Nicola Lindgren
nomination_text: For giving me advice on blogging, seo and linking me with people in the community who can help

name: Marta Wo≈∫niak-Semeniuk
nomination_text: Book recommendation at Test Bash Leadership - reminding us to read Kahneman's Thinking Fast and slow.

name: Lina Zubyte
nomination_text: The long overdue new #QualityFoundations blog post on Definition of Ready - and there's an article for Definition of Done too. https://qualitybits.tech/writing/definition-of-ready

name: Kika (Kiruthika) Ganesan
nomination_text: For an inspirational talk at TestBash Leadership on Taking the Leap to Leadership. A powerful first talk of hers!

name: Gareth Waterhouse
nomination_text: For returning to testing and becoming Principal Test Engineer at ASOS!

name: Sanne Visser
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Joep Schuurkes
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Huib Schoots
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Elizabeth Zagroba
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Cirilo Wortel
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Patrick Prill
nomination_text: Patrick's test framework is going to be a significant game changer for his team and beyond. I'm really happy to have him in the team, and immensely appreciate his willingness to share knowledge, his insights and attention to detail.

name: Patrick Prill
nominated_by: Nominated by Fl√°vio H. de Freitas
nomination_text: Our grumpy friend! It is a pleasure to have him on the team. He is always helping everyone around, coming with great ideas, and shaking the quality of our process, code and deliverables. Life is definitely more fun with him around. We learn and have fun, while building an amazing product.

name: Petros Plakogiannis
nomination_text: Petros always helps and supports testers around the world with free webinars and trainings! He has 'community first' attitude! Also, as far as I know he help testers to find jobs! This is great because he does all the things in his free time so we salute him!

name: Simon P. Schrijver
nomination_text: Ten year milestone on the 5blogs curation list: The (best) five blogs he read each day. Check them out.

name: Prachi Dahibhate
nomination_text: I know Prachi from last 2 years now and she has done great job. She keep upscaling her as she started doing more about testing trial and error things, she wrote many blogs based on different topics, she got chance to write about testing blog as well as she participated in many testing community competition where she won the several prizes and goodies.

name: Alan Richardson
nomination_text: for his API challenges at https://www.eviltester.com/page/tools/apichallenges/, providing a space to learn about APIs and practice testing them.

name: Eva Podbrdsk√°
nomination_text: for staying in the cancelled #99MinutesChallenge, sharing her approach and helping me to reflect my own solution approach. So wonderful to learn from each other.

name: Stuart Crocker
nomination_text: By chance redefining Quality as: Quality is the absence of unnecessary friction. Making the relative interaction actionable - something we can ask towards: What causes unnecessary friction and work on that. That's where the unspoken requirements hide.

name: Federico Toledo
nomination_text: Fede has always been super helpful in testing community, sharing posts in his site (https://www.federico-toledo.com/), writing the book 'Introduccion a las Pruebas de sistemas de Informacion', sharing his insights in all sort of conferences and webinars, hosting the QualitySense podcast. With his deep and clear insights he is always willing to share and learn about new practices and collaborate.

name: Andrei Guch√≠n
nomination_text: Andrei is a test leader with great experience in performance testing. He has contributed with so many articles and presentations in the topic, in English and Spanish. He has helped many fellow testers to learn and grow in very challenging projects.

name: James Thomas
nomination_text: For your insightful talk 'Exploring with Automation' - absolutely loved your way of sharing knowledge, experience, mindset, and especially how you approach things. Special kudos for giving this talk for students and help them grow!

name: Niranjan Limbachiya
nomination_text: A true leader and passionate tester. He build a software professional network called Testing Tech News. Also he is founder of testing organization called KiwiQA. He is always ready to help you to build your career and provide guidance.

name: Lisi Hocke
nomination_text: Lisi's blog post today about starting her new job inspired me to approach my day differently. She's so generous to share her experiences.

name: Bob Salmon
nomination_text: for writing articles that explain exceptions, Modularisation and Encapsulation for everyone on https://randomtechthoughts.blog/

name: Constance Hermit
nomination_text: For your amazing way of conveying technical knowledge in an accessible manner while representing the variety of people and identities in your illustrations! Most recent example is your Gatling article. We need more like you, thank you so much!

name: Daniel Knott
nomination_text: For creating his YouTube channel, giving people access to clear, distilled information in video format

name: Meg Mackay
nomination_text: The article on 'Choose Your Own Test Adventure: A Strategy Template' https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/choose-your-own-test-adventure-strategy-template-meg-mackay/

weblinks.name: Choose Your Own Test Adventure: A Strategy Template'

name: Ndubuisi Mathew Omegara
nomination_text: For incredible dedication to software testing, continuous self-development and being one of the best bug-hunters we've ever had. Damn fine service to our company and the software industry as a whole. Absolute pleasure to work with!

name: Louise Harney
nomination_text: For openly sharing your reflections on becoming a solo tester and actively asking for feedback and inspiration - you are amazing!

name: Leila Gregory
nomination_text: For your extensive briefing before my new job, for making me feel welcome from day one, for our invaluable experience exchanges, for your trust and kindness. I feel honored to work with you!

name: Bruce Hughes
nomination_text: For the article: Power of Small Goals - the visuals, the honesty and for relating a challenge we all have. We need ways to trick ourselves to achievable actions.

name: Bruce Hughes
nomination_text: Bruce's latest blog post https://undevelopedbruce.com/2022/01/12/the-power-of-small-goals/ reminded me the magic of small steps! Helped me overcome today's attack of imposter syndrome.

name: Vern Richards
nomination_text: Vern has been sharing his thoughts day after day with brilliant thoughts and insights through atomic essays. Top effort and so worth reading. Thanks fella

name: Vernon Richards
nomination_text: For your amazing Typeshare essays - what insightful nuggets of experience and wisdom! Thank you for sharing with all of us.

name: Lena Pejabat Wiberg
nomination_text: Incredible support of other folks in the community

name: Lee Marshall
nomination_text: Since joining the team, Lee has been celebrated in every Review and Retrospective as a positive, shaping member who adds a tremendous amount of value and asks difficult questions. At the same time, maintaining a creative, positive and productive atmosphere. Business Analysts and Developers now ask themselves, 'What would Lee ask here?'

name: James Thomas
nomination_text: I loved his work regarding a latency issue at Ada Health! Thanks so much

name: Patricio Miner
nomination_text: He has a great youtube channel with useful content in Spanish, lots of tutorials, demos and courses, helping many people to break into tech and grow, while having fun with their videos.

name: Craig Morten
nomination_text: Might be the biggest testing advocate at ASOS for quality, his work on accessibility has been amazing and eye opening. He is probably the best TDD Coach we have ever had and he has endless capacity to support and teach others.

name: √Åine McGovern
nomination_text: √Åine does incredible work supporting the testing community by supporting meetups and sharing tonnes of useful information. She's a cornerstone of the community ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Veerle Verhagen
nomination_text: For starting a book club to (re)read Agile Testing Condensed, organizing live chats about the progress and sharing their learnings

name: Samuel Nitsche
nomination_text: For starting a book club to (re)read Agile Testing Condensed, organizing live chats about the progress and sharing their learnings
